body:
### Describe the bug

The generated C code for the following function fails to compile from Cython 3.2 onwards, but is fine when using 3.1.7. The error is:
```
bug.c: In function ‘__pyx_gb_3bug_2generator’:
bug.c:2632:32: error: assignment to expression with array type
 2632 |     __pyx_cur_scope->__pyx_t_1 = __pyx_t_2;
      |                                ^
bug.c:2643:15: error: assignment to expression with array type
 2643 |     __pyx_t_2 = __pyx_cur_scope->__pyx_t_1;
      |               ^
```

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

```cython
def function():
    cdef char* result = "ABC"

    for ch in "X":
        result[0] = ch
        yield 0
```
Both the loop and the yield appear to be necessary to trigger this.

### Expected behaviour

_No response_

### OS

Linux

### Python version

3.12.3

### Cython version

3.2.1

### Additional context

`__pyx_t_2` holds the `"X"`. Cython 3.1.7 declares it the following way:
```c
unsigned char const *__pyx_t_2;
```
But Cython 3.2 declares it as an array:
```
Py_UCS4 __pyx_t_2[1];
```
The initialization changes from
```c
__pyx_t_2 = ((unsigned char const *)((char const *)"X")); // Cython 3.1.7
```
to
```c
__pyx_t_2[0] = 88; // Cython 3.2.1
```
But the assignment (the one shown in the error message) did not change.

I searched the issues and found the `assignment to expression with array type` error message only in #5178, which I believe is not related.

Reported to me at https://github.com/marcelm/cutadapt/issues/864

comment_data.body:
I came up with a funny trick to solve this. Instead of storing away the literal C array as a global constant or keeping it in the generator's closure, we can generate it in place before looking up the loop item in it, all inside of the loop body. That looks silly in the C code, but the tight usage scope and the visible literal array values allow the C compiler to pull all its tricks to make the loop efficient. And it minimises the amount of temporary variables that we need to store in the generator closure while yielding.

I validated that the resulting assembly looks reasonable with gcc 13 for generators as well as for simple loops. I'll send a PR shortly.

EDIT: as discussed in the PR, gcc does not actually take advantage of seeing the array content and generated fairly slow code as a result.
I think the changes for a clean fix are not trivial, and it's only an optimisation in the end. We could disable it for the 3.2 series, at least inside of generators, and try to get it right in 3.3.

PR https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/7338 deactivates the optimisation inside of generators. This should fix the immediate problem for 3.2.2 and the later 3.2.x releases. I'll keep looking into a better solution for 3.3.

In https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/7339, I might have found a middle-ground for a fix that could go into 3.2.x.

It basically switches to a `static const` C array for the optimised C array iteration cases, which I think are the only ones where users are not in control of the C array themselves.

We decided to resolve this in Cython 3.2.2 by merging https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/7338, which disables the C array iteration optimisation inside of generators.

We consider https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/7339 a better fix but with a higher risk of breakage. It will go into the master branch for 3.3 to prove reliable, and might then make its way into 3.2.x as well, potentially 3.2.3.
Awesome, thanks a lot! I was happy to see the quick reaction to the report; I appreciate you spending time on this.

title: [BUG] error: assignment to expression with array type
